intro: Lessingia cymulosa, commonly known as the clustered lessingia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Lessingia cymulosa thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
